zh: 幼儿园的小朋友们手拉手在公园里走着。

en: Crude persuasion is to persistently egg someone on.
zh: 所谓拙劣的劝说就是在那儿死命地怂恿人。

en: It is an act of cruelty to lock a small child in his room.
zh: 把小孩锁在房间里太残忍了。

en: The infant has faith in his mother taking care of him.
zh: 婴儿信任妈妈会照顾好自己。

en: Infants are subject to diseases.
zh: 婴儿很容易生病。

en: An infant is not capable of speaking, so it just screams until it gets what it wants.
zh: 婴儿不会说话，所以想要什么就只能一直叫，直到大人明白为止。

en: We need more medical care for infants.
zh: 我们需要更多的婴幼儿医疗服务。

en: The little boy embraced his dog.
zh: 小男孩搂住了他的狗。

en: The little girl stuck out her tongue at him.
zh: 小女孩对他吐了吐舌头。

en: I heard a young girl call for help.
zh: 我听到一个小姑娘在呼救。

en: A young child has a small vocabulary.
zh: 小孩子的词汇量很小。

en: Very young children don't know many words.
zh: 年纪很小的孩子知道的词儿不多。

en: Young children should be exposed to good music.
zh: 应该让小孩子多接触些好的音乐。

en: It is absurd to believe that young children can run faster than policemen.
zh: 觉得小孩能跑得比警察快，这也太荒唐了。

en: Child as he was, he was brave.
zh: 虽说是个孩子，但他挺勇敢的。

en: Prophets have been forecasting the end of the world for centuries.
zh: 几个世纪以来，先知们一直在预言世界末日。

en: I'd like to open a savings account.
zh: 我想开个储蓄账户。

en: I'll open a bank account.
zh: 我想开个银行账户。

en: I want to deposit some money.
zh: 我想存点钱。

en: Could you give me back my valuables?
zh: 能把我的贵重物品还给我吗？

en: Heed public opinion.
zh: 要多听取民意。

en: The ruling party is running a smear campaign against the opposition.
zh: 执政党正对反对党进行抹黑攻击。

en: The government got their majority at the last election.
zh: 政府在上次选举中获得了多数票。

en: The party in power is corrupt, but the opposition is little better.
zh: 执政党很腐败，但反对党也好不到哪儿去。

en: The ruling party pushed its tax bill through.
zh: 执政党强行通过了税收法案。

en: The ruling party has secured 50 seats as of 5 o'clock.
zh: 截至五点，执政党已经拿下了50个席位。

en: Party leaders are hammering out a proposal for political reform.
zh: 党的领导人们正在商定一份政治改革方案。

en: I've nothing to give.
zh: 我没什么好给的。

en: Minds that have nothing to confer find little to perceive.
zh: 肚子里没货的人，也看不出什么名堂。

en: It is more blessed to give than to receive.
zh: 施比受更有福。

en: It's necessary for you to make the best use of your time.
zh: 你得好好利用你的时间。

en: You should put aside some money when you can afford to.
zh: 手头宽裕的时候，你应该攒点钱。

en: We have no spare money.
zh: 我们没有闲钱。

en: We have no extra money.
zh: 我们没有多余的钱。

en: We don't have any extra money.
zh: 我们一点余钱都没有。

en: We have plenty of time to spare.
zh: 我们有的是时间。

en: We have time to spare.
zh: 我们的时间还很充裕。

en: I want to spend rest of the life pursuing my ideals.
zh: 我想用余生去追求我的理想。

en: The extra effort raised his blood pressure above normal.
zh: 过度劳累让他的血压超出了正常范围。

en: Go about your business.
zh: 去忙你的吧。

en: None of your business.
zh: 不关你的事。

en: It's none of your business!
zh: 关你什么事！

en: Attend to your own business.
zh: 管好你自己的事。

en: Try to utilize your leisure for reading.
zh: 试着利用空闲时间读点书。

en: Try to make good use of your spare time.
zh: 尽量利用好你的业余时间。

en: What's your favorite pastime?
zh: 你平时最喜欢怎么消遣？

en: Make the best of your time.
zh: 抓紧时间。

en: Leisure has been viewed as a means to an end.
zh: 休闲一直被看作是达到目的的手段。

en: You needn't worry too much.
zh: 你不用太担心。

en: Don't eat too much.
zh: 别吃太多。

en: I didn't enjoy it very much.
zh: 我没觉得那有多好玩。

en: They consider it impolite to disagree with someone they don't know very well.
zh: 他们觉得和不怎么熟的人唱反调很不礼貌。

en: I'm afraid it's not a good idea.
zh: 恐怕这不是个好主意。

en: Too many people are indifferent to politics.
zh: 太多人对政治漠不关心了。

en: The reservation number is 1003.
zh: 预约号是1003。

en: Are there reserved seats on the train?
zh: 火车上有对号入座的位子吗？

en: All subscriptions must be paid before the end of this year.
zh: 所有的订阅费都必须在年底前付清。

en: The reservation desk, please.
zh: 请接预订台。

en: Please tell the reservation clerk, Mr Ichiro Takahashi, your credit card number to confirm your reservation.
zh: 请把信用卡号告诉预订员高桥一郎先生，以确认您的预约。

en: Will the fare change if I change the reservation?
zh: 如果我改签，票价会变吗？

en: I'd like to change my reservation.
zh: 我想改一下预订。

en: Could you cancel my reservation?
zh: 能帮我取消预订吗？

en: In order to get a reservation, you must use her name.
zh: 必须用她的名字才能订上。

en: Can I make a reservation?
zh: 我可以预订吗？

en: I'd like to change my reservation from three to five nights.
zh: 我想把预订从住三晚改成住五晚。

en: I'm going to leave one night early.
zh: 我打算早走一个晚上。

en: I'm going to leave one night earlier than I had planned to.
zh: 我打算比原计划早走一个晚上。

en: I'm going to leave one day early.
zh: 我打算早走一天。

en: I'm going to leave one day earlier than I had planned to.
zh: 我打算比原计划早走一天。

en: I'd like to change my reservation for three to five nights.
zh: 我想把预订的三晚改成五晚。

en: All the seats are sold in advance.
zh: 位子都提前卖光了。

en: I have a confirmed reservation.
zh: 我的预订已经确认了。

en: Please make your reservation one week in advance.
zh: 请提前一周预订。

en: At which window can I make a reservation?
zh: 在哪个窗口可以办理预订？

en: Could I make a reservation?
zh: 我能预订吗？
